findings.title: Absence of Input Validations in intialize() function
findings.description: The initialize() function allows passing imperative arguments like decimal for the token and the total supply. However, during the review, it was found that no adequate input validations have been provided in the functions.

findings.title: Redundant functions increase contract size unnecessarily
findings.description: The contract includes additional private view functions like checkWhitelisted() and checkBlacklisted() to simply return whether or not an address is whitelisted. However, these functions can easily be removed if the _whitelist and _blacklist mappings are made public.

findings.title: Invalid error messages found
findings.description: The require statement in the addToWhitelist() function includes an invalid error message.

findings.title: initializer() modifier should be removed from constructor
findings.description: The initializer modifier has been assigned to the constructor of the Farmsent contract which will lead to an unwanted scenario where the deployer won’t be able to initialize() the contract at all after deployment.

findings.title: External Visibility could be used
findings.description: Functions that are never called within the contract should be marked as external visibility instead of public visibility.

findings.title: Coding Style Issues in the Contract
findings.description: The code readability of a Smart Contract is largely influenced by the Coding Style issues and in some specific scenarios, may lead to bugs in the future.

findings.title: initialize() function has an invalid error message
